intro: Steffensia pothifolia, commonly known as the coastal bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States, particularly California. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along coastal areas and is adapted to salty, windy environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, inconspicuous fruits that contain seeds. Steffensia pothifolia is a rare and endangered species, often found in specific microhabitats along the Pacific coast.
